resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

worklogs.comment:
kinow commented on pull request #3307: ARROW-295: add DOAP file
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3307
 
 
   Hi,
   
   Went to have a look at the [Apache Project listing](https://projects.apache.org/projects.html?language) and couldn't find Arrow there, so quickly grabbed Avro's DOAP, compared with a few Commons' DOAP files, and here's the result.
   
   Notes:
   
   - Use GitHub instead of git-wip (as far as I know, [git-wip is EOL](https://blogs.apache.org/infra/entry/relocation-of-apache-git-repositories), and all projects have to migrate to GitBox).
   - Couldn't find a Wikipedia page for Arrow. That's where I normally find when the project was created, so used the [TLP project announcement](https://blogs.apache.org/foundation/entry/the_apache_software_foundation_announces87) date for the project `created` value.
   - Use README's list of programming languages to create the list in this DOAP file.
   - Some projects include updating DOAP release notes during/after the release, but it is not mandatory, and some (most?) ASF projects have outdated dates for the release in their DOAP files... having a DOAP file with valid metadata is still useful.
   
   Happy to update branch it if necessary. 
   
   Other comments:
   
   - Validated with W3C RDF validator, looks OK
   - Built site locally and pushed to my fork to test that the DOAP file appeared correctly in the [browser](https://kinow.github.io/arrow/arrow.rdf). Basically, by having the file in the `site` directory and not including it in the `_config.yaml` to be excluded seems to be enough
   - If/once merged, the ASF project listing would still lack Arrow. That's because someone (a PMC or committer) still needs to follow the [documentation for projects](https://projects.apache.org/create.html) and updated the [ASF SVN XML](https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/comdev/projects.apache.org/trunk/data/projects.xml) used. But that's just one line, pointing to http://arrowapache.org/arrow.rdf
   
   Cheers
   Bruno
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

emkornfield commented on issue #3307: ARROW-295: add DOAP file
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3307#issuecomment-460089697
 
 
   I'm not a committer, but this seems reasonable to me.   I couldn't seem to find a corresponding file in some other apache projects so I don't know if there is a better place for this.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the

For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

kinow commented on issue #3307: ARROW-295: add DOAP file
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3307#issuecomment-460090375
 
 
   >I'm not a committer, but this seems reasonable to me.
   
   Thanks @emkornfield 
   
   > I couldn't seem to find a corresponding file in some other apache projects so I don't know if there is a better place for this.
   
   It just needs to be anywhere that is web accessible. I use the same location as in Avro (http://avro.apache.org/avro.rdf). Jena keeps their DOAP in a different location (http://jena.apache.org/about_jena/jena.rdf), but still under the site.
   
   It is also possible to avoid putting the RDF/XML file in the site, and instead store in the ASF CMS repository, as Commons Math does (http://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/commons/cms-site/trunk/doap/doap_math.rdf).
   
   Once the link is publicly available, a PMC (or maybe a committer can too?) must go to https://projects.apache.org/create.html and complete the form, using the link for the DOAP file, so that it appears under the ASF projects listing.
   
   Happy to change the location of this DOAP file if necessary 👍 
   
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

 Review comment:
   Updated, and also the release date as appears in the project main page. Note that the revision and created date are not always up to date. i.e. not all projects add a step in their release management process to update their DOAP files. While it would be better to keep it as up to date as possible, I think having the DOAP file in place is already a good start :)

kinow commented on issue #3307: ARROW-295: [Documentation] Add DOAP file
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3307#issuecomment-472247551
 
 
   Thanks @wesm , in summary, just a metadata file, not used as official release information, but defines some project metadata used by ASF Infra to list Apache Projects here https://projects.apache.org/.
   
   Some semantic web application may also use DOAP files. But my intention was to have this file so that Apache Arrow would appear in that Apache Projects site (some contributors search projects there).
   
   Now it just needs someone from the project to follow the instructions here https://projects.apache.org/create.html, and update https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/comdev/projects.apache.org/trunk/data/projects.xml. Then Arrow should be listed there :tada: 
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

comments.body:
Logged in exactly to create an issue for the DOAP file. I am doing more Python now, while still involved with Commons/Jena/OpenNLP and other Java projects. So every now and then I search for projects in ASF with Python, like Thrift, SIS, and I thought I would find Arrow using that [site that lists ASF projects by language|https://projects.apache.org/projects.html?language].

But as Arrow does not have a DOAP file in  [https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/comdev/projects.apache.org/trunk/data/projects.xml] I couldn't find it there. So just sent a pull request with a tentative doap file.

Cheers
